Trial_Design.evidence: This prospective observational study included adult patients undergoing upper-limb surgery under supraclavicular brachial plexus block.

Participants.evidence: This prospective observational study included adult patients undergoing upper-limb surgery under supraclavicular brachial plexus block.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the accuracy of infrared thermography in predicting failed segmental supraclavicular brachial plexus block.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Outcomes were the ability of temperature change at each site to predict failed block of the corresponding nerve using area under receiver-operating characteristic curve (AUC) analysis.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Eighty patients were available for the final analysis.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Eighty patients were available for the final analysis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The AUC (95% confidence interval [CI]) for the ability of temperature change at 5 min to predict failed ulnar, median, and radial nerve block was 0.79 (0.68–0.87), 0.77 (0.67–0.86), and 0.79 (0.69–0.88).
